WGBH-HMV—
I have just returned to Boston from the Second NAEB TV Engineering Workshop and
wish to express my appreciation to the NAEB, yourself, and the personnel of
WKAR-TV for a most pleasant and valuable week*
It is very difficult to suggest an improvement in the setup or organization of
the Workshop, with the exception of minor details such as better location of
monitors and such small items* I do not think that it would be possible or
advisable to try to operate the equipment with such a large group, since most
of them already have equipment of their own*
In addition to the technical information supplied by the speakers, the course
was most valuable in enabling the Chief Engineers of the various stations to meet
each other and swap ideas and experiences, and it is ny earnest hope that an
effort will be made to make this an annual affair. Another valued result from
this Workshop was to bring to the attention of all concerned that the NAEB Engi¬
neering Service is there and ready to help* This is not always realized by some
of us who do not have too dose contact*
Arthur Wo Richardson
*********'*
Memphis Community TV Foundation--
This member wishes to report the following as per your request*
lo No suggested change in set-up or organization. This member feels the workshop
was extremely well planned and organized*
2o This member expected to receive the value of meeting with other engineers in
the educational television field and exchanging information* This was accom^
plished,
3, This member realizes that in a period as short as four and one-half deys,
there is not ample time for twenty-five people to operate equipment*
iic This member feels that the entire workshop was a great success* The workshop
was well planned, organized, and executed. All was accomplished in as short
a time as could possibly be expected. The program was excellent*
5* This member wishes to express his appreciation for the present NAEB Engineering
service. The workshop is invaluable* The newsletter is a great help In keep¬
ing members informed. It is suggested that an availability sheet for both
equipment and personnel be incorporated in the newsletter. Many of us are in
the market for competent engineers and good used equipment* Perhaps some mem¬
ber or non-members have a surplus of equipment or personnel available; if so
we would like to know*
It Is further suggested the regional workshops be seVup if possible, This
would be accomplished at greater frequency than the national workshop * Per¬
haps members in the lower echelon could be revolved which would give them a
chance to clear information which would in turn make them feel part of the
scheme and make them better engineers. This would also give the other par¬
ticipating members a feeling of belonging* A regional workshop of this type
